padding-bottom--lg"><div class="row"><div class="col docItemCol_Qr34"><div class="docItemContainer_tjFy"><article><nav class="theme-doc-breadcrumbs breadcrumbsContainer_T5ub" aria-label="Breadcrumbs"><ul class="breadcrumbs"><li class="breadcrumbs__item"><a aria-label="Home page" class="breadcrumbs__link" href="/"><svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" class="breadcrumbHomeIcon_sfvy"><path d="M10 19v-5h4v5c0 .55.45 1 1 1h3c.55 0 1-.45 1-1v-7h1.7c.46 0 .68-.57.33-.87L12.67 3.6c-.38-.34-.96-.34-1.34 0l-8.36 7.53c-.34.3-.13.87.33.87H5v7c0 .55.45 1 1 1h3c.55 0 1-.45 1-1z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg></a></li><li class="breadcrumbs__item"><a class="breadcrumbs__link" href="/docs/red-team/strategies/"><span>Strategies</span></a></li><li class="breadcrumbs__item"><span class="breadcrumbs__link">Conversational</span></li><li class="breadcrumbs__item breadcrumbs__item--active"><span class="breadcrumbs__link">GOAT</span></li></ul></nav><div class="tocCollapsible_wXna theme-doc-toc-mobile tocMobile_Ojys"><button type="button" class="clean-btn tocCollapsibleButton_iI2p">On this page</button></div><div class="theme-doc-markdown markdown"><div style="position:relative"><header><h1>GOAT Technique for Jailbreaking LLMs</h1></header>
<p>The GOAT (Generative Offensive Agent Tester) strategy is an advanced automated red teaming technique that uses an &quot;attacker&quot; LLM to dynamically generate <strong>multi-turn</strong> conversations aimed at bypassing a target model&#x27;s safety measures.</p>
<p>It was <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2410.01606" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="">introduced by Meta researchers</a> in 2024 and achieves high success rates against modern LLMs by simulating how real users interact with AI systems, with an Attack Success Rate (ASR@10) of 97% against Llama 3.1 and 88% against GPT-4-Turbo on the JailbreakBench dataset.</p>
<h2 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_tleR" id="implementation">Implementation<a href="#implementation" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Implementation" title="Direct link to Implementation" translate="no">​</a></h2>
<p>Use it by selecting it in the Strategies UI or by editing your config:</p>
<div class="language-yaml codeBlockContainer_mQmQ theme-code-block" style="--prism-color:#393A34;--prism-background-color:#f6f8fa"><div class="codeBlockTitle_kY6l">promptfooconfig.yaml</div><div class="codeBlockContent_t_Hd"><pre tabindex="0" class="prism-code language-yaml codeBlock_RMoD thin-scrollbar" style="color:#393A34;background-color:#f6f8fa"><code class="codeBlockLines_AclH"><span class="token-line" style="color:#393A34"><span class="token key atrule" style="color:#00a4db">strategies</span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">:</span><span class="token plain"></span><br></span><span class="token-line" style="color:#393A34"><span class="token plain">  </span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">-</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token key atrule" style="color:#00a4db">id</span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">:</span><span class="token plain"> goat</span><br></span><span class="token-line" style="color:#393A34"><span class="token plain">    </span><span class="token key atrule" style="color:#00a4db">config</span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">:</span><span class="token plain"></span><br></span><span class="token-line" style="color:#393A34"><span class="token plain">      </span><span class="token key atrule" style="color:#00a4db">maxTurns</span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">:</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token number" style="color:#36acaa">5</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token comment" style="color:#999988;font-style:italic"># Maximum conversation turns (default)</span><span class="token plain"></span><br></span><span class="token-line" style="color:#393A34"><span class="token plain">      </span><span class="token key atrule" style="color:#00a4db">stateful</span><span class="token punctuation" style="color:#393A34">:</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token boolean important" style="color:#36acaa">false</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token comment" style="color:#999988;font-style:italic"># Sends the entire conversation history with each turn (Default)</span><br></span></code></pre></div></div>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-info admonition_WCGJ alert alert--info"><div class="admonitionHeading_GCBg"><span class="admonitionIcon_L39b"><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7 2.3c3.14 0 5.7 2.56 5.7 5.7s-2.56 5.7-5.7 5.7A5.71 5.71 0 0 1 1.3 8c0-3.14 2.56-5.7 5.7-5.7zM7 1C3.14 1 0 4.14 0 8s3.14 7 7 7 7-3.14 7-7-3.14-7-7-7zm1 3H6v5h2V4zm0 6H6v2h2v-2z"></path></svg></span>info</div><div class="admonitionContent_pbrs"><p>If your system maintains a conversation history and only expects the latest message to be sent, set <code>stateful: true</code>. <a class="" href="/docs/providers/http/#server-side-session-management">Make sure to configure cookies or sessions in your provider as well.</a></p></div></div>
<h2 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_tleR" id="how-it-works">How It Works<a href="#how-it-works" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to How It Works" title="Direct link to How It Works" translate="no">​</a></h2>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" alt="GOAT LLM attack" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," width="1000" height="700" class="img_SS3x"></p>
<p>GOAT uses an attacker LLM that engages in multi-turn conversations with a target model.</p>
<p>The attacker pursues multiple adversarial techniques: output manipulation, safe response distractors, and fictional scenarios. Unlike simpler approaches, GOAT adapts its strategy based on the target model&#x27;s responses, similar to how human red teamers operate.</p>
<p>Each conversation turn follows a structured three-step reasoning process:</p>
<ol>
<li class=""><strong>Observation</strong>: Analyzes the target model&#x27;s previous response and identifies triggered safety mechanisms</li>
<li class=""><strong>Strategic Planning</strong>: Reflects on conversation progress and develops the next approach</li>
<li class=""><strong>Attack Generation</strong>: Selects and combines appropriate techniques to generate the next prompt</li>
</ol>
<p><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" alt="GOAT attack flow" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," width="1000" height="750" class="img_SS3x"></p>
<p>This process is looped until we either achieve the goal or reach a maximum number of turns.</p>
<p>GOAT&#x27;s effectiveness stems from its ability to simulate realistic user behavior while maintaining technical sophistication.</p>
<p>Instead of relying on brute-force approaches or static prompts, its dynamic conversation and reasoning make it particularly effective at identifying vulnerabilities in LLM applications.</p>
<h2 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_tleR" id="related-concepts">Related Concepts<a href="#related-concepts" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Related Concepts" title="Direct link to Related Concepts" translate="no">​</a></h2>
<ul>
<li class=""><a class="" href="/docs/red-team/strategies/multi-turn/">Multi-turn Jailbreaks</a></li>
<li class=""><a class="" href="/docs/red-team/strategies/tree/">Tree-based Jailbreaks</a></li>
<li class=""><a class="" href="/docs/red-team/strategies/iterative/">Iterative Jailbreaks</a></li>
</ul>
<p>For a comprehensive overview of LLM vulnerabilities and red teaming strategies, visit our <a class="" href="/docs/red-team/llm-vulnerability-types/">Types of LLM Vulnerabilities</a> page.</p></div></div><footer class="theme-doc-footer docusaurus-mt-lg"><div class="row margin-top--sm theme-doc-footer-edit-meta-row"><div class="col noPrint_QeZL"><a
